CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper June 23, 1962, pg. 13, reads: "Concert Artists - The above were featured artists in a concert presented by the Norris Music Club, at Stephen Foster Memorial Hall, recently.  From left, first row: Alfred C. Morris, talented violinist, winner of the Norris Club's $1,000 scholarship award; Elizabeth Johnson, 'Queen' of the club for 1962-63; Edna Maye, soprano, of Carnegie Tech and Martha Morris, one of the accompanists for the choir. Second row: Samuel Rhyne, violinist; Edward Rhodes, who played the viola, and Cornelius Richardson, singer.  Third row: Brian Kovac, pianist and Pittsburgh Concert Society winner; Richard Clark, celloist, and John Anthony, baritone of West Virginia State College. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Musicians from concert presented by Norris Music Club, first row from left: Alfred C. Morris, Elizabeth Johnson, Edna Maye, Martha Morris; second row: Samuel Rhyne, Edward Rhodes, Cornelius Richardson, singer; third row: Brian Kovac, Richard Clark, and John Anthony, in Stephen Foster Memorial Hall
